channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South Koreans arrested in U.S. immigration raid being sent home
item.description: U.S. immigration authorities are preparing to send more than 300 South Korean workers home on a chartered flight from Atlanta, a week after detaining ...

item.title: Inflation climbs in August as grocery and gas prices jump
item.description: Inflation accelerated in August as Americans paid more for gasoline and groceries. Over the last 12 months, consumer prices have risen 2.9%.

item.title: Scientists link hundreds of severe heat waves to fossil fuel producers' pollution
item.description: A new study finds dozens of heat waves would be "virtually impossible" without the activity of major fossil fuel producers, including oil companies.

item.title: U.K. fires its ambassador to Washington over emails to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: In one email, Peter Mandelson wrote to Jeffrey Epstein, "I think the world of you and I feel hopeless and furious about what has happened." In another...

item.title: NPR's next news chief built an international career at CNN
item.description: NPR has promoted Thomas Evans, its editorial review chief, to lead the newsroom through a period of change, following Congress' decision to end federa...

item.title: Israeli strikes in Yemen kill 35 people, Houthis say
item.description: The Israeli military says it hit military targets, but the Houthis say only civilian sites were targeted.

item.title: Politicians condemn killing of Charlie Kirk
item.description: Conservative activist and commentator Charlie Kirk was shot and killed while he was speaking at a Turning Point USA event at Utah Valley University on...

item.title: Charlie Kirk’s killer blended in on Utah university campus, and a high-powered rifle is recovered
item.description: President Donald Trump says he’ll posthumously award conservative activist and ally Charlie Kirk the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

item.title: Search for Charlie Kirk's killer continues. Here's what we know.
item.description: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot and killed on Wednesday while speaking an event at Utah Valley University. Authorities have not identified...

item.title: South African court rules that men can take wife's surname
item.description: The highest court rules that a law barring men from taking the surnames of their wives is a "colonial import".

item.title: Influencer investigated for "dangerous and illegal" crocodile wrestling
item.description: In a series of social media videos, bare-chested Mike Holston, who goes by "therealtarzann" online, tussles with saltwater and freshwater crocodiles.

item.title: Jobless claims reach highest level since 2021, a sign layoffs are rising
item.description: As the job market weakens, the number of Americans applying for unemployment benefits jumped last weak to its highest level in nearly four years.

item.title: More than 300 Koreans detained by ICE in Georgia are heading home
item.description: The ICE raid that swept up 300 South Koreans in Georgia has strained an important bilateral relationship, and highlighted a significant challenge.

item.title: Charlie Kirk: Conservative influencer who rallied a youth movement
item.description: Kirk, an influential Trump ally who at age 18 set up Turning Point USA, died in a shooting while speaking at a Utah campus event.

item.title: Assassination of Charlie Kirk adds to America’s roll call of public violence
Ireland threatens to withdraw from Eurovision if Israel participates
item.description: The Irish broadcaster said that Ireland's participation in the contest "would be unconscionable given the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza"...

item.title: France suspects foreign intelligence over pigs heads left outside mosques
item.description: Foreign nationals are blamed for the incident, which has striking similarities with other recent provocations.

item.title: What to know about the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
